name: sepal
short_description:
an plant-imaging site that puts elegant design first. A ton of these already exist, but the design is usually hideous. In short, I want a one-stop shop where you can find the following characteristics for any plant:
* various images of the plant from different angles (mostly so we can identify them in real life)
* complete taxonomy info, sensibly delineated (family, genus, species, variety, cultivar, etc) (with optional history of the why of this particular classification)
* morphology/pictures by seed and/or flower, leaf pattern, stem arrangement
* reproductive info (seed dispersal, pollination, etc)
* mutualistic or parasitic relationships between it and other plants/insects
* evolutionary origin by geography, closest living relative by molecular and/or morphological structure,
* if possible, a complete view of its genome sequencing
* best habitat for flourishing (amt of sunlight, water, soil type, climate, altitude, etc)
summary: An elegant way to view every plant (and its attributes) in the world.
